application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1 Eucalyptus - Remove tree as the residents are wanting to landscape in the area. 
T2 Ash - Remove ash tree. The tree has had the back cut back into main trunk so it's now very much one sided.
T3 Hawthorn - Remove group of trees as they are of a poor shape. 
T4 Ash - Remove tree as the trunk is in a poor shape.
T5 Horse chestnut - Remove tree as the residents want to landscape on that part of garden.
T6 Cherry-   Remove tree as the residents want to landscape on that part of garden.
G1 Leylandii x 3  Remove tree as the residents want to landscape on that part of garden.
decision_conditions: T6 Cherry-  Not to be removed.
T6 Cherry is a good specimen with good vitality and vigour.
The trees that are on this property which is within the Gidea Park Conservation Area, it is recommended that the following trees may be removed,
T1 Eucalyptus - Remove tree this is a poor specimen
T2 Ash - Remove ash tree. The tree has had the back cut back into main trunk so it's now very much one sided.
T3 Hawthorn - Remove group of trees as they are of a poor shape.
T4 Ash - Remove tree as the trunk is in a poor shape.
G1 Leylandii x 3  Remove tree as the residents want to landscape on that part of garden and are of low quality.

Please note that if the work for which consent is granted is not carried out within 2 years of the date of this letter, it will be necessary to submit a fresh application if it is intended to implement the work.
